comment.author: 59045075@N06
comment._content:
There was a custom observed by all steamboats passing up and down the Potomic River; past Mt. Mount Vernon.

This was a question in a beautiful little text book (Surveying and Navigation by James Pitcher; pub.1893). At the end of the text is Washington's full farewell address.

An answer would be wonderful.  I'm guessing its a sequence of whistles!
